body_html:
anyone still having this problem? I have wheel installed in both pip2 and pip3, still the command fails

pablo@batman tensorflow (master) $ pip2 list
DEPRECATION: The default format will switch to columns in the future. You can use --format=(legacy|columns) (or define a format=(legacy|columns) in your pip.conf under the [list] section) to disable this warning.
certifi (2017.7.27.1)
chardet (3.0.4)
cryptop (0.1.0)
idna (2.5)
mercurial (4.3.1)
numpy (1.13.1)
pip (9.0.1)
requests (2.18.2)
setuptools (32.1.0)
six (1.10.0)
urllib3 (1.22)
wheel (0.29.0)
yasm (0.0)
pablo@batman tensorflow (master) $ pip3 list
DEPRECATION: The default format will switch to columns in the future. You can use --format=(legacy|columns) (or define a format=(legacy|columns) in your pip.conf under the [list] section) to disable this warning.
pip (9.0.1)
setuptools (32.2.0)
virtualenv (15.1.0)
wheel (0.29.0)
pablo@batman tensorflow (master) $ bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
Tue Sep 12 21:52:39 -03 2017 : === Using tmpdir: /var/folders/p2/1n2xjbq93hn4sd7lgj9mv4c80000gn/T/tmp.XXXXXXXXXX.TBZdyy7q
~/Documents/work/projects/forks/tensorflow/bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles ~/Documents/work/projects/forks/tensorflow
~/Documents/work/projects/forks/tensorflow
/var/folders/p2/1n2xjbq93hn4sd7lgj9mv4c80000gn/T/tmp.XXXXXXXXXX.TBZdyy7q ~/Documents/work/projects/forks/tensorflow
Tue Sep 12 21:52:41 -03 2017 : === Building wheel
usage: setup.py [global_opts] cmd1 [cmd1_opts] [cmd2 [cmd2_opts] ...]
   or: setup.py --help [cmd1 cmd2 ...]
   or: setup.py --help-commands
   or: setup.py cmd --help

error: invalid command 'bdist_wheel'

body:
anyone still having this problem? I have wheel installed in both pip2 and pip3, still the command fails

```
pablo@batman tensorflow (master) $ pip2 list
DEPRECATION: The default format will switch to columns in the future. You can use --format=(legacy|columns) (or define a format=(legacy|columns) in your pip.conf under the [list] section) to disable this warning.
```
